instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.ALL_SYS_PWGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD. When you see ALL_SYS_PWGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF: What is SMC_ONOFF? SMC_ONOFF is a signal that tells the machine that the power button has been pressed so it knows to turn on, or turn off. .

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message:
No water damage, no visible corrosion.
Tried PRAM reset with a new keyboard (don't have external), connector looks good.
Tried SMC Bypass, Safe Mode, known working drive.
Don't have USB mouse, used iPhone w/ammeter and see that it is charging the iPhone 1.5A I think it said.
VCore is 1.74V
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWGD</SIGNAL> 3.3V
Fan spins normal and speeds up when it gets hot. Spins high-speed in SMC Bypass.
Using brand new known good battery and 85W from Apple store.

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message: Is external keyboard mandatory? & it has to be a USB keyboard and not a wireless keyboard, correct? & I imagine it has to be an Apple keyboard for the option and power button right? LOL

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message:
Any USB keyboard will work, windows key is command. USB mouse is needed to. 
History on this board?

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message:
...............I don't have the history, the person it came from doesn't know either. It seems very clean and untouched. Runs nice. I know it is no use measuring everything if have VCore, <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWGD</SIGNAL>, & <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF</SIGNAL> (or is my thinking wrong)? I will get a mouse and keyboard...............

[I was going to ask about this keyboard mouse thing, but see Louis has a video on it. Thank you Louis!]

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message: With USB mouse attached it will blink the light for 1 second and thats it. In my HP laptop the light stays on. So I am assuming a brain-dead board? And with a PC USB keyboard and shorting cap on and holding Window key, Alt, P, R does nothing. Tried all several times. Pulling the plug on life support.

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message: Check traces from <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> to Y1905. Check J6100 for crap. Try another BIOS, save the old!!

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message:
For BIOS I can just pull and put on another, nothing special I have to do?

I will try !

Question: so if there was a light on the mouse, then you say its brain dead?

threads.title: 3476 Has VCore, no: boot, image, chime etc
threads.message: If there is a light on the mouse the board is working to some extent. You can only swap BIOS for testing, if it works then ME region needs fixing.
